title.rendered: They scam more than 130,000 euros in NFTs from Zilverk, the trendy VTuber

content.rendered:
As much as Willyrex, Vegetta and many other creators ensure that NFTs are the future of collecting, the truth is that we still have a lot to learn in such a new territory. Rare is the day when we did not know about a new scam related to the sector, and streamers in favor of this market they are not immune to the scams

The last to suffer it has been Zilverka popular Mexican VTuber who had thrown himself headlong into creating something known as Ratz. This is content in NFT format -of which he is a great supporter- that he pretended to have presented yesterday, but plans went awry.

“Today is not the best of days,” he says in a statement explaining what happened. “The announcement we intended to make today has been canceled so we believed a technical failure, and in the end that failure turned out to be a theft“.

According to his account, one of the developers (whose nickname is Unexplained.eth) the funds intended for the development and maintenance of the NFTs that were going to go on sale were transferred. The value of the operation was 1400 sunshinea cryptocurrency whose unit costs, right now, more than 22 euros. The embezzlement thus amounts to 137,000 euros.

Although they trusted this person and they say he had a good reputation, after putting that money the guy disappeared: “we are looking for him and the moneybut if you thought we were going to surrender and that this was a post to say goodbye to the project, you are very wrong.

Zilverk assures that it will continue financing its Ratz, although it recommends that its followers take security measures with their accounts so that the cheeky one who plucked them don’t keep the money from the fans too.

Moral of all this? That the NFT thing for the moment must be taken with tweezers, only if you have some money left overand always knowing that the sector where you get into is the most unstable. If they give it with cheese to people who know how, imagine those who have no idea… Instead of NFT, use the acronym NTF: do not trust.
